data.title: Languages under a New Skin: Arabic in Syriac Writing, or the Importance of the Karshūnī Texts for an Overpowered Culture
data.abstractNote: In this paper the autor offers an state of art on the scriptural practice in Karshūnī, which appears to be the product of an Arabic acculturation process designed by the Arab-Islamic power, with the end result of a dual linguistic assimilation by the Christian communities under the dominant culture imposed by the Arab-Islamic state.
